business.headline: An Autumn Davos in India? Ashwini Vaishnaw flags new idea at WEFAn Autumn Davos in India? Ashwini Vaishnaw flags new idea at WEF

Sensex, Nifty extend losses a day after sharp sell-off; rupee hits record lowThe Nifty 50 closed 0.3% lower at 25,157.5, while the BSE Sensex slipped 0.33% to settle at 81,909.63. Both indices touched fresh three-month lows during the day. In the previous session, the Nifty had fallen 1.4% and the Sensex had dropped 1.3%.

Deepinder Goyal steps down as Eternal CEO, Blinkit's Albinder Dhindsa to take overThe online delivery firm, which runs food delivery platform Zomato and quick commerce arm Blinkit, reported a sequential increase in profit for the third quarter, driven by strong demand for quick-delivery services.

India's AI push puts it on path to global tech powerhouse, says Ashwini VaishnawThe Union Minister said AI is now being used almost everywhere, making it essential for countries to build capabilities across all layers of the technology.

Why EU-India FTA will be Mother of All Deals, and Trump deserves a thanksAfter almost two decades of work and negotiations, the India-EU Free Trade Agreement (FTA) is the closest it has ever been to fruition. The deal would not only benefit both sides enormously, but also come as a rude awakening for US President Donald Trump.

RIL shares face January blues, trade at 5-year oversold levels. Should you buy?RIL share price: The country's most valuable listed company with a market value of close to $210 billion, has seen its shares slide sharply since the start of the year.

Gold hits record Rs 1.57 lakh: Is it time to buy, hold or sell?Gold has touched a new peak of Rs 1.57 lakh, fuelled by rising geopolitical tensions and safe-haven demand. As the rally gathers pace, the key question for investors is whether to enter now or wait for a pullback.

AI, trade risks and growth: Why India still stands out for global investorsAnanya Birla, Director at the Aditya Birla Group, spoke about trade disruptions and tariffs, saying short-term volatility cannot be ignored. However, she said long-term investors continue to see India as a stable and high-growth market.

EPFO 3.0 coming soon: New platform, core banking system and regional language supportThe Employees' Provident Fund Organisation (EPFO) is preparing for its next major digital upgrade, EPFO 3.0. The move aims to make PF services faster, more user-friendly and accessible to workers across both organised and unorganised sectors.

Kalyan Jewellers share price tumbles 12%: Why is the stock falling today?While the broader market was weak, the depth of the fall pointed to a mix of technical stress, institutional activity and sector-specific caution.

Rupee slides past 91 per US dollar: What is driving the fall?The sharp slide came as global uncertainty rose once again. Investors worldwide have been shifting money toward safer assets, which has strengthened the US dollar and put pressure on emerging market currencies.

Sensex tumbles 900 points: 5 reasons why the stock market is falling todayAt 11:07 am, the Sensex was down 895.64 points to 81,303.08, while the Nifty dropped 252.35 points to trade at 24,980.15. Read to know the key factors behind today's bloodbath on Dalal Street.

Gold at record highs, silver inching closer to Rs 3.5 lakh: Should you buy now?With both metals roaring to lifetime levels, investors are torn between fear of heights and fear of missing out. Whether this is a peak or a fresh beginning is the real question now.

India remains top investment bet despite global volatility: Ananya BirlaSpeaking about the global business environment, Ananya Birla said artificial intelligence is changing the way companies operate at a rapid pace.

Sensex, Nifty face high volatility: 4 reasons behind tug of war on Dalal StreetThe indices opened firmly in the green, tumbled into the red within minutes, and then began clawing their way back, mirroring the nervous, headline-driven mood dominating global markets.

Sensex, Nifty slip as global risk-off mood builds on Trump tariff fearsAt 9:22 am, the Sensex was down 183.61 points or 0.22 percent at 81,996.86, while the Nifty edged 32.20 points lower to 25,200.30.

Sensex, Nifty trading setup: Will Dalal Street indices crash again today?On Tuesday, the Nifty fell around 1.4% and the Sensex slipped about 1.3%, marking their sharpest single-day fall in more than eight months.
Amagi Media Labs IPO listing today: What GMP says about market debut?Investors who have not seen their status can check their allotment on the BSE and MUFG Intime India Pvt Ltd websites.

Sensex, Nifty continue losing streak in 2026: What should investors do?Weak corporate earnings, rising global trade worries and steady foreign fund outflows continued to weigh on investor confidence, pushing benchmark indices to their lowest closing levels in over three months.

US stocks slide as Trump threatens tariffs on 8 European nations over GreenlandUS stocks suffered their sharpest fall in months as technology shares led losses, safe-haven assets surged, global markets weakened, and investors weighed inflation risks amid escalating trade uncertainty.

entertainment.headline: Hrithik Roshan's 'Bollywood biceps' refuse to age, internet asks: Really 52? Hrithik Roshan dropped what can be seen as the most ravishing 2016 photo-dump on social media. The actor showed off his sculpted body, while talking about the pressure of dealing with his self-obsession of having "Bollywood biceps."

Amid Beckham saga, Victoria posts birthday wishes for ex-Spice Girl Emma Bunton Victoria Beckham shared warm birthday wishes for ex-Spice Girls bandmate Emma Bunton. This is Victoria's first public post amidst a family feud with son Brooklyn.

Why a small film like Dhandoraa matters to Telugu cinema  A quiet Telugu social drama, Dhandoraa has found renewed attention after its OTT release for its restrained take on caste and everyday injustice.

Rachel McAdams gets her Walk of Fame star, thanks Diane Keaton in emotional speech Canadian actor Rachel McAdams, known for her roles in Mean Girls and The Notebook, was awarded a star on the Hollywood Walk of Fame on Tuesday, with colleagues and family celebrating her 25-year career.

Why was Varun Dhawan chosen to play Param Vir Hoshiyar Singh in Border 2? Read here Producer Nidhi Dutta revealed why Varun Dhawan was chosen to play Major Hoshiyar Singh in Border 2. She condemned negative PR against the actor portraying a Param Vir Chakra hero.

O'Romeo trailer: Shahid Kapoor, Triptii Dimri promise a dark, raw romantic thriller Shahid Kapoor and Vishal Bhardwaj return for their fourth project together with O'Romeo. The trailer for the film introduced intense action and complex characters, marking Bhardwaj's return to theatres after several years.

RGV backtracks after claiming Sukhwinder Singh made Jai Ho, not AR Rahman Director Ram Gopal Varma responded on social media after an old interview resurfaced in which he seems to suggest Sukhwinder Singh, not AR Rahman, created the Oscar-winning song Jai Ho. Varma's clarification comes amid renewed debate over the song's authorship and comments about the film and music industry.

Actors Jayaram and Urvashi reunite after 20 years for Pandiraj's new comedy film Veteran actors Jayaram and Urvashi are collaborating once again for director Pandiraj's upcoming comedy, rekindling their successful on-screen partnership after 20 years.

No stars, no director, just a date: Assi poster sets social media buzzing A cryptic film announcement for Assi, revealed without cast, crew, or production details, has caught the attention of Bollywood enthusiasts online.

Jennifer Lopez donates money to homeless man during New York City outing. Video Jennifer Lopez was seen giving cash to a homeless man in Los Angeles shortly after receiving criticism online for her recent interaction with Glambot director Cole Walliser at the Golden Globes.

Emraan Hashmi's Taskaree tops Netflix's global non-English TV list Netflix original series Taskaree: The Smuggler's Web, starring Emraan Hashmi, has made history by becoming the first Indian show to debut at number one on Netflix's Global Top 10 Non-English TV list, highlighting the growing international appeal of Indian storytelling.

Dhurandhar 2 brings back Vicky Kaushal as Major Vihaan Shergill of Uri: Report Vicky Kaushal is set to join Aditya Dhar's Dhurandhar 2 in an extended cameo. The actor will reportedly play Major Vihaan Shergill, his character from Dhar's 2019 blockbuster, Uri: The Surgical Strike.

Draupathi 2 maker reveals why he wanted Theri postponed, but not Mankatha Director Mohan G explains why he did not ask Sun Pictures to reschedule the re-release of Ajith's Mankatha, while expressing gratitude to producer Kalaipuli S Thanu for accommodating his request regarding Theri re-release.

Will Rajamouli's Varanasi release on Ram Navami? Makers drop hint in new post SS Rajamouli's Varanasi is expected to release on Ram Navami in 2027. The film features a grand Ramayana episode with Mahesh Babu as Lord Ram, promising a cinematic spectacle.

Rihanna's witty reply to bodyguard after door shuts on her goes viral Rihanna was seen responding to her bodyguard with a witty remark after a door closed in her face outside the Four Seasons hotel in New York City, an incident that has circulated widely online.

Daldal trailer: Bhumi Pednekar hunts a serial killer while battling inner demons Prime Video has unveiled the trailer for Daldal, a crime thriller starring Bhumi Pednekar. The series explores a gripping serial murder case set in Mumbai with deep psychological undercurrents.

Aamir Khan expresses concerns about making Mahabharata, calls it cultural mission Aamir Khan shared his aspirations and concerns about adapting the Mahabharata epic. He emphasised the cultural significance and challenges of such a project.

Sivakarthikeyan's Parasakthi hits Rs 100 crore globally, fifth milestone for actor Sudha Kongara's political drama Parasakthi, starring Sivakarthikeyan, collected Rs 100 crore worldwide in 10 days. This is the actor's fifth Rs 100-crore grosser in his career.

RGV claims Sukhwinder Singh made Oscar-winning Jai Ho, not AR Rahman, in old video A resurfaced interview with director Ram Gopal Varma has led to renewed controversy over the true composer of the Oscar-winning Jai Ho song from Slumdog Millionaire. The video went viral amid Rahman's latest statement about work bias.

general news.headline: PM Modi saw the Trump trap coming. Other leaders didn'tEurope learnt it the hard way that trade agreements and flattery do not insulate even close allies from Trump's tariffs. Prime Minister Narendra Modi read the US President right months ahead and helped India avoid the Trump trap. The world should take note.

Deepinder Goyal steps down as Eternal CEO, Blinkit's Albinder Dhindsa to take overThe online delivery firm, which runs food delivery platform Zomato and quick commerce arm Blinkit, reported a sequential increase in profit for the third quarter, driven by strong demand for quick-delivery services.

Maha puzzle: Shinde Sena-MNS tie-up derails BJP's mayor bid in KalyanIn Kalyan-Dombivli, the Eknath Shinde-led Shiv Sena kept aside its bitter rivalry with Raj Thackeray's Maharashtra Navnirman Sena (MNS) to stitch up an alliance to prevent the BJP from securing the mayor's post.

Rules-based order was a lie: Canada's Mark Carney's stunning rebuke of US at DavosCanadian Prime Minister Mark Carney said the US-led global order is over, warning that great powers now weaponise trade and economic integration, and urging middle powers like Canada to adapt and protect themselves

RGV backtracks after claiming Sukhwinder Singh made Jai Ho, not AR RahmanDirector Ram Gopal Varma responded on social media after an old interview resurfaced in which he seems to suggest Sukhwinder Singh, not AR Rahman, created the Oscar-winning song Jai Ho. Varma's clarification comes amid renewed debate over the song's authorship and comments about the film and music industry.

Is an India-UAE-Israel axis forming to counter Saudi-Pak-Turkey Islamic Nato?Donald Trump has made the US focus on its interests. Europe appears divided. But far from the western hemisphere, military and security equations are changing in Southern and Western Asia. The churn, triggered by Pakistan and Saudi Arabia joining hands for a Nato-like pact, with Turkey looking to join it, has sparked questions over whether an India-UAE-Israel axis is quietly taking shape to counter the "Islamic Nato".

Why EU-India FTA will be Mother of All Deals, and Trump deserves a thanksAfter almost two decades of work and negotiations, the India-EU Free Trade Agreement (FTA) is the closest it has ever been to fruition. The deal would not only benefit both sides enormously, but also come as a rude awakening for US President Donald Trump.

An Autumn Davos in India? Ashwini Vaishnaw flags new idea at WEFUnderscoring the growing global recognition of the country's economic reforms and investment momentum, Union Minister Vaishnaw pitched for an 'Autumn Davos' at the World Economic Forum (WEF).

Why the world must thank Mark CarneyCanadian PM Mark Carney's Davos speech shreds the myth of a fair Western order, calling out the US as a disruptor. His advice to middle powers amidst Trump's tariffs and threats: adapt or perish.

Will there be an early end to Trump's madness?Just a year into Donald Trump's second term and not just Americans, the whole world is anxious. From tariffs on nearly all countries to deposing a head of state, to threats of acquiring territory by force, every day is a new antic. All this has led to low approval ratings for Trump in the midterm year. Will the midterm elections clip his wings and tame his madness? Here's an analysis.

AAP, Congress aim to block BJP as open voting reshapes Chandigarh mayoral raceFor the first time in the city's history, the mayor will be elected through an open "show of hands" instead of a secret ballot, a reform introduced after years of controversy and allegations of manipulation. The one-time AAP-Congress understanding comes against the backdrop of a deeply polarised Municipal Corporation House and memories of the turbulent 2024 mayoral polls.

Four months into marriage, UP man finds wife with 3 men, kills herThe man strangled his wife to death four months after their marriage over suspected infidelity and confessed to the police the next day.

At 26, Simran Bala from J&K set to lead all-male CRPF unit on Republic DaySimran Bala, a 26-year-old Assistant Commandant from Jammu and Kashmir, is set to create history by becoming the first woman officer to lead an all-male CRPF contingent at the Republic Day Parade on January 26. Her journey from a border town to Kartavya Path reflects changing leadership norms in India's forces.

Sony to stop manufacturing Bravia TVs, gives TV division control to TCLSony will stop making Bravia TVs on its own and hand control of its TV business to TCL under a new joint venture, while keeping the Bravia brand alive. Here is everything you need to know.

Will it really rain in Delhi this week? Experts say here's whenMeteorologists track a series of western disturbances poised to impact Delhi. Experts break down the atmospheric conditions that could bring a wet end to the month.

Amid Beckham saga, Victoria posts birthday wishes for ex-Spice Girl Emma BuntonVictoria Beckham shared warm birthday wishes for ex-Spice Girls bandmate Emma Bunton. This is Victoria's first public post amidst a family feud with son Brooklyn.

Is India seeing a 'surprise baby' boom as GLP-1 use takes off?As GLP-1 drugs reshape India's weight-loss landscape, they may also be quietly rewriting reproductive outcomes. Surprise "Ozempic babies" are catching patients and doctors alike off guard.

Will penguins win against climate change? Science has the answerA decade-long study finds Antarctic penguins are shifting their breeding seasons at record rates as climate conditions change, with significant impacts on species diversity and ecosystem stability.

Live: Trump heading to Davos amid Greenland standoff after glitch on Air Force OneWorld Economic Forum Davos Live Updates: US President Donald Trump is set to address the annual meeting of the World Economic Forum in Davos today amid a row over his punitive tariffs that have rattled global markets and shaken allies.
He will also participate in a greeting with the forum's leadership, meet foreign leaders and attend a reception with business leaders.
Trump's presence at Davos comes amidst tensions between the US and European nations over his push to acquire Greenland and impose tariffs on countries until "a deal" is reached to purchase Greenland. Trump and his entourage boarded a new aircraft to reach the venue after his Air Force One had to return to Joint Base Andrews near Washington DC after a "minor electrical issue" was detected onboard.

Forced nudity, unknown injections: Iranians pay heavy price for defying KhameneiChants of "Mullahs must go" have been throttled in Iran. What is now emerging from under Iran's digital darkness is a harrowing trail of abuse and human rights violations. From forced nudity in freezing outdoors to being injected with unknown substances, jailed protesters are facing the wrath of the Khamenei regime.

Gandhi, Savarkar, Jinnah: Three men, one nation, and their irreconcilable ideasA riveting conversation on Gandhi, Savarkar and Jinnah at JLF 2026 reveals how personal relationships, ideological clashes and political missteps shaped India's freedom and Partition. Historians Alex von Tunzelmann, Kishwar Desai and Makarand Paranjape unpack forgotten meetings, shifting identities and decisions that continue to shape India's politics today.

Virat Kohli loses No. 1 spot in ODI rankings to New Zealand's Daryl MitchellICC ODI rankings: New Zealand star Daryl Mitchell dethroned Virat Kohli to become the new No.1 batter in ICC ODI rankings on the back of his batting heroics in the Blackcaps' historic series win in India.

'Entitled' mother lets child stand on tray table, changes diaper on Vande Bharat seatThe account, shared on Reddit's r/IndianRailways forum with the title "Entitled mother with lack of civic sense", claimed that the woman first attempted to take another passenger's window seat. When the person refused, she made the journey uncomfortable by changing her child's diaper on the seat and left the soiled one on the floor.

OnePlus says India operations will continue as usual, company is not shutting downOnePlus has denied rumours of shutting down, saying its India operations are running as usual, even as reports point to changes in the brand's global strategy under parent company OPPO.

sports.headline: 1st T20I Live: Suryakumar, Santner kick off crucial T20 World Cup prep India (IND) vs New Zealand (NZ) Live Score: India and New Zealand begin their final phase of preparation ahead of the T20 World Cup 2026. The forms of several stars, including India captain Suryakumar Yadav, will be in focus in the opener of the series.

IPL 2026: Kolkata Knight Riders appoint Dishant Yagnik as fielding coach IPL 2026: Kolkata Knight Riders appoint Dishant Yagnik as fielding coach ahead of IPL 2026, strengthening a star-studded support staff and completing a major rebuild after an aggressive auction.

Charith Asalanka returns as captain: Sri Lanka name 15-man squad for England ODIs SL vs ENG: Charith Asalanka returns as Sri Lanka captain for the England ODI series, with Dhananjaya de Silva recalled and several senior pacers missing as Colombo hosts all three matches.

Carlos Nadal: Alcaraz all smiles as fan's gesture wins heart in Australian Open Australian Open: Carlos Alcaraz lit up Rod Laver Arena with both his tennis and his personality, playfully responding to a playful "Carlos Nadal" shout from the stands before cruising past Yannick Hanfmann in straight sets.

Suryakumar Yadav given golden advice by former opener ahead of T20 World Cup Former India opener Aakash Chopra has given key advice to captain Suryakumar Yadav amid his poor T20I form. Chopra urges him to play straighter shots and spend more time at the crease ahead of the T20 World Cup 2026.

Pakistan offers to host Bangladesh's T20 World Cup games: Report The Pakistan Cricket Board (PCB) has reportedly offered to host Bangladesh's T20 World Cup matches while backing its refusal to play the tournament in India.

Indonesia Masters: PV Sindhu digs deep to enter pre-quarterfinals PV Sindhu overcame a tough challenge from Manami Suizu in the opening round of the Indonesia Masters Super 500. Meanwhile, Kidambi Srikanth needed three games to overcome his first-round opponent, Koki Watanabe of Japan at the Istora on Wednesday, January 21.

Virat Kohli loses No. 1 spot in ODI rankings to New Zealand's Daryl Mitchell ICC ODI rankings: New Zealand star Daryl Mitchell dethroned Virat Kohli to become the new No.1 batter in ICC ODI rankings on the back of his batting heroics in the Blackcaps' historic series win in India.

Is Federer good at golf? Alcaraz rates tennis great's game after playing together World No. 1 Carlos Alcaraz took a golfing break with Roger Federer at the Australian Open. The Spaniard rated the Swiss great's skills on the course after his second-round win at Melbourne Park on Wednesday, January 21.

Pakistan backs Bangladesh's refusal to tour India for T20 World Cup: Report The Pakistan Cricket Board has reportedly backed Bangladesh's decision to refuse to play its T20 World Cup matches in India, citing "security concerns," in a communication sent to the ICC.

IPL 2026: RCB given January 27 deadline to inform BCCI about home venueRajasthan Royals (RR) and Royal Challengers Bengaluru (RCB) have been given January 27 deadline to inform BCCI about their home venues for Indian Premier League 2026 (IPL 2026).

T20 World Cup defence first, verdict on Gautam Gambhir can waitIndia vs New Zealand: Criticism of Gautam Gambhir has intensified after India's ODI series loss at home to a second-string New Zealand side. While Gambhir must be questioned over India's inconsistent results, the head coach needs breathing space as the team turns its focus to a five-match T20I series against New Zealand ahead of next month's T20 World Cup title defence.

Manjrekar defends Gill, Gambhir after NZ loss: Only World Cup matters in ODIsFormer cricketer Sanjay Manjrekar defends team India after a rare home ODI series loss to New Zealand. He urges fans to prioritise the World Cup over bilateral series results.

ICC' s T20 World Cup verdict on Bangladesh live: Final decision to be out todayICC's decision on Bangladesh live: The International Cricket Council (ICC) is set to announce their verdict on Bangladesh's participation in the T20 World Cup 2026 today. The Bangladesh Cricket Board (BCB) has been in a stand-off with the BCCI and is not willing to send their team to India for the T20 World Cup, citing security concerns.

Kohli scores and returns to London, doesn't need domestic cricket: Former batterFormer India cricketer-turned commentator Mohammad Kaif applauds Virat Kohli's hunger and form despite skipping domestic games. Kohli was recently seen in rich form during ODI series against New Zealand.

After beating India in Tests, ODIs can New Zealand complete trifecta in T20I series?After beating India in Test and ODI series, New Zealand will back themselves to stun the hosts once again, this time in the T20I format. Backed by big-hitters and disciplined bowling, Mitchell Santner and Co. Will be fancying their chances right from the first match in Nagpur.

Bodo/Glimt 3-1 Man City: Champions League shocker in Norway piles pressure on PepChampions League: Manchester City suffered one of their worst European nights as they went down 3-1 to Norwegian minnows Bodo/Glimt. Shaky results since the turn of the New Year have led to rumours that Pep Guardiola could exit the Premier League club before the end of his current contract.

Pressure on Suryakumar Yadav as India enter home stretch of T20 World Cup prepIndia vs New Zealand: Skipper Suryakumar Yadav has one final opportunity to iron out his batting concerns as India face New Zealand in a five-match T20I series, using the contest as a crucial tune-up ahead of their T20 World Cup title defence in less than three weeks.

Day 4 Live Updates: Yuki Bhambri off to winning start, Alcaraz into Round 3Australian Open 2026 Day 4 Live Updates: Aryna Sabalenka and Elina Svitolina have made their way into Round 3, having registered clinical victories against Zhuoxuan Bai and Linda Klimovicova respectively. Meanwhile, Carlos Alcaraz is in action in his second round fixture at the Rod Laver Arena.

IND vs NZ, 1st T20I predicted XI: Ishan Kishan at No.3 but will India go spin-heavy?IND vs NZ, 1st T20I Predicted XI: Ishan Kishan is set to return at No.3 for India in the 1st T20I against New Zealand, while the hosts debate going spin-heavy or backing Harshit Rana as they fine-tune plans for the 2026 World Cup.

Jemimah stands tall as Delhi Capitals beat Mumbai Indians to stay in playoff raceDC vs MI, WPL 2026: Jemimah Rodrigues struck an unbeaten fifty to steer Delhi Capitals past Mumbai Indians by seven wickets, surviving a tense middle phase and late drama to keep their playoff hopes alive in Vadodara.

Out or not out? Third umpire's delayed decision on Lizelle Lee stumping confuses fansWPL 2026, MI vs DC: Lizelle Lee's stumping triggered a five-minute third-umpire review and a storm of reactions online, with fans split over whether she was really out as controversy overshadowed her fluent knock.

Australian Open 2026: Jannik Sinner cruises to round 2, Osaka made to work hardJannik Sinner started his Australian Open 2026 campaign with a two-sets win over Hugo Gaston, who had to retire due to an injury. Naomi Osaka made a fashion statement on Tuesday, but was made to work hard to progress to round two in Melbourne.

After Australian Open loss, Oliynykova delivers moving tribute and plea for UkraineAustralian Open 2026: Oleksandra Oliynykova used a post-match T-shirt at the Australian Open to send a quiet plea for Ukraine, honouring her soldier father and finding a powerful voice beyond the tennis result.

Pole vaulter dismisses Railways clarification over Panvel station ordealA day after he and his coach were forced to deboard a train at Panvel Railway Station for carrying sports equipment, India's national record holder in pole vault, Dev Kumar Meena, has dismissed the Railways' clarification over the incident.

India vs New Zealand T20I series: Full schedule, squads, live-streaming detailsIndia and New Zealand are all set to lock horns ahead of the T20 World Cup 2026 in an exciting five-match series, starting from January 21. Here's all you need to know about the five-match series.

India women's team to tour South Africa for 5 T20Is before T20 World Cup 2026South Africa will host India for a five-match women's T20I series in April 2026, with matches set for Durban, Johannesburg, and Benoni. The series serves as preparation for both teams ahead of the ICC Women's T20 World Cup.

DC vs MI: 16-year-old Deeya Yadav becomes youngest-ever WPL debutantSixteen-year-old Deeya Yadav, popularly known as 'Chhoti Shafali', became the youngest player ever to debut in the Women's Premier League. Meanwhile, Mumbai Indians also handed a WPL debut to Vaishnavi Sharma in their group-stage clash.

Not safe for me to answer: Bangladesh captain avoids T20 World Cup questionBangladesh captain Litton Das avoided a question about T20 World Cup, saying that it isn't safe for him to answer the query at the moment.

Suryakumar Yadav shrugs off form concerns: Not playing tennis, this is a team sportIND vs NZ: India T20I captain Suryakumar Yadav plays down his lean patch ahead of the New Zealand series, saying team success matters more than personal milestones as India build towards the 2026 World Cup.

education.headline: The role of data analytics in modern advertising educationThis transformation also exercises a significant impact on the realm of 'advertising education.'

NCERT deletes Azad Pak, adds China's aggression reference in Class 12 textbookThe NCERT has made final changes to its Class 12 Political Science textbook syllabus for the upcoming academic year, including a revision in reference to India's border situation with China, Azad Pakistan, Article 370 and more.

NEET row: Bihar cops find 6 post-dated cheques 'issued for question paper brokers'Six post-dated cheques which were suspected to have been issued in favour of mafia demanding over Rs 30 lakh from each candidate seeking alleged leaked question paper ahead of NEET held last month were recovered by Bihar Police.

Forest fires surge tenfold from 2004 to 2017: Causes, impact and preventionAmidst a relentless surge, intense forest fires are now multiplying tenfold, casting a menacing shadow over our flora and fauna. Year by year, their fiery grip tightens, threatening ecosystems far and wide, now extending their reach to impact human lives.

Fresh plea in Supreme Court to recall NEET results, reconduct examsA fresh petition has been filed in the Supreme Court to recall the National Entrance cum Eligibility Test - Under Graduate (NEET-UG) 2024 results and re-conduct fresh examination after discrepancies in the declared results.

NTA issues clarification after NEET result controversy over toppers, high cut-offIn a detailed statement, the National Testing Agency (NTA) said that the increase in cut-off and number of toppers in the NEET-UG reflect the competitive nature of the exam and maintained that the test's integrity has not been compromised.

Exclusive: Arvind Kejriwal claims 'BJP succession war, PM backing Amit Shah'Speaking exclusively to India Today TV, Delhi Chief Minister Arvind Kejriwal claimed that there is a "succession war" within the BJP. He also claimed that the ruling party is "not fighting the Lok Sabha elections as a team".

4 medical students arrested in Bihar for appearing as proxies for NEET aspirantsFour MBBS students who appeared in place of NEET aspirants in the medical entrance exam were detained in Bihar's Purnea.

NEET-UG question paper not leaked, claims baseless: National Testing AgencyThe reports claiming question paper leak in the medical entrance exam NEET-UG are "completely baseless and without any ground", the National Testing Agency (NTA) has clarified.
The generation with answers: Tech-savvy Indian youth tackling global challengesIndia's tech-savvy youth rewriting the global narrative, one solution at a time.

Left sweeps JNU students' polls, Dhananjay is first Dalit presidentThe Left swept the Jawaharlal Nehru University Students' Union (JNUSU) polls, winning all four posts and trouncing the RSS-affiliated ABVP. The ABVP was leading at one point, but the Left eventually surged ahead and emerged victorious.
The power of knowledge: Education's influence on real estate market trendsIn a dynamic sector like real estate, investing in continuing education is not simply an option; it is a requirement.

JNU students' body election on March 22 after 4 yearsThe Jawaharlal Nehru University Students' Union (JNUSU) polls will take place on March 22, more than four years after the last elections were held in September 2019.

UP 12th board exam math, biology papers leaked on WhatsApp, complaint filedThe mathematics and biology question papers for the Uttar Pradesh class 12 board exam were allegedly leaked on a WhatsApp group.

UP Police Constable recruitment exam cancelled days after paper leakThe Uttar Pradesh Police Constable recruitment exam held on February 17 and 18 was canceled due to a paper leak. The Chief Minister has announced a re-examination within the next six months.
